comment.author: 62379908@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called A vintage year: 1933, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 22070130@N07
comment._content: Great - I think the plane was the William Horlick, a modified Curtiss T-32 Condor II? www.south-pole.com/p0000108.htm en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curtiss_Condor

comment.author: 28471042@N00
comment._content: Could this be the plane who's engine was used on His sledge ? This Flickr site is Top Notch !! You do a First-Rate job in educating hungry minds.

comment.author: 32741315@N06
comment._content: Hi J e n s - you're absolutely right! Here's another pic of the seaplane from our collection: mp.natlib.govt.nz/detail/?id=20258 and a zoomable view of the image here: ndhadeliver.natlib.govt.nz//view/action/ieViewer.do?from_... If you zoom in you can see it clearly says William Horlick Condor 41 Curtiss Wright. -Chelsea
